legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Receive Written Rent Receipt
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Your landlord must provide a signed written rent receipt every time you pay rent.

sections: General provision - issuance of rent receipts
law_reference.notes: Exact section numbers differ by jurisdiction.

legal_rights_hub.explanation: A written receipt protects tenants from false claims of unpaid rent. Must include amount paid, date, period, and property details. Refusal is violation under most Rent Control Acts.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to demand a written receipt for every rent payment, regardless of payment method.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: Landlords may falsely claim unpaid rent, leading to wrongful eviction attempts.
actions_if_violated: Use evidence in court if needed
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Privacy and Quiet Enjoyment
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: You have the right to peaceful use of your home. Landlord cannot harass you or enter without notice.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Quiet enjoyment means peaceful use without unreasonable landlord interference. Cannot enter without 24-48 hours notice. Cannot create uninhabitable conditions.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to peaceful, uninterrupted use of your home without landlord interference.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: Sue for damages, request rent reduction, terminate lease without penalty.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Maintenance and Livable Conditions
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Your home must be safe and clean. Landlord must repair within reasonable time.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Landlords responsible for habitable conditions: functional water/electricity, no structural damage, proper sanitation, weather protection.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to live in safe property with landlord repairing within 7-14 days.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: Withhold 20-50% rent, hire contractor and deduct costs, terminate lease.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Deposit Return
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Your security deposit must be returned in full within 30-45 days after you move out.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Landlord must return deposit within 30-45 days. Only legitimate deductions allowed (actual damage, unpaid rent). No deductions for cleaning or penalty.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to recover your full deposit minus only documented deductions.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Challenge Illegal Eviction
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Your landlord cannot evict you without court order. Self-help eviction is illegal and criminal.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Only court can order eviction. Self-help (lock-out, removing belongings, threats) is illegal and criminal. Valid reasons: non-payment (3+ months), lease violation, contract end.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to remain until court orders eviction.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: File FIR for criminal offense, file civil suit, get court reentry order.
actions_if_violated: If notice received, respond within time
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Reasonable Rent Increase
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Rent cannot be increased arbitrarily. Must follow legal limits and proper notice.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Increases must follow legal limits (5-10% annually) with 30-90 days advance notice. Unreasonable or improper increases can be challenged.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to reasonable increases with proper notice.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: Refuse increase, continue paying old rent, sue, terminate lease.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Refund of Illegal Charges
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Landlords can only charge rent and one security deposit. All other charges must be refunded.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Beyond rent and one deposit, no additional deposits, maintenance fees, advance rent, or hidden charges allowed. All illegal charges recoverable with interest.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to pay only agreed rent and one deposit.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Know Landlord Identity
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Your landlord must identify themselves and be traceable for legal proceedings.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Landlord must provide legal name, address, contact details. If agent collects rent, actual owner's details must be disclosed. Unknown landlords cannot enforce eviction.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to know landlord's legal identity.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: Lease becomes void, refuse payment, get protection against eviction.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Dispute Resolution Before Eviction
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Your landlord must give you a chance to fix the problem (cure period) before eviction.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Before eviction filing, landlords must give cure period. Usually 30-90 days to pay arrears or fix violation. If cured, eviction abandoned.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to fix the issue before legal eviction.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: Eviction dismissal if procedure not followed.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.

legal_rights_hub.title: Right to Lease Agreement in Writing
legal_rights_hub.short_summary: Your tenancy agreement must be in writing and signed by both landlord and tenant.
legal_rights_hub.explanation: Written agreements protect both parties by clearly stating rent, duration, responsibilities. Oral leases create disputes and are hard to prove.
legal_rights_hub.your_right: You have the right to a written, signed agreement with all terms.
legal_rights_hub.consequences_of_violation: Disputes harder without proof. Oral lease is defense against unfair claims.
legal_rights_hub.disclaimer: This summary explains legal rights in simple language. It does not replace advice from a licensed lawyer.
